abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column praises way New York City authorities have worked collaboratively to come up with solution to inability of emergency responders' vehicles to accommodate large, motorized wheelchairs used by many people with disabilities; suggests response should be replicated with respect to host of other issues that frequently go ignored by city authorities.
lead_paragraph: In New York City, problems big and small can seem nearly impossible to resolve, but this time, the city bureaucracy seems to have fixed one, helping its citizens who rely on wheelchairs.

headline.main: Where Puzzles Often Persist, One Was Solved
headline.print_headline: In a City Where Many Puzzles Seem to Defy Solving, One Gets an Answer

snippet: In New York City, problems big and small can seem nearly impossible to resolve, but this time, the city bureaucracy seems to have fixed one, helping its citizens who rely on wheelchairs.
